doc.title: We review our take on the electronic components sector following Apr- Jun results. Earnings at many companies were trending ahead of FY3/26 guidance announced with FY3/25 results, reflecting 1) conser
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Japan Electronic Components April-June results review and investment strategy leading up to H1 results April-June result_2025-08-31

passages.text: We review our take on the electronic components sector following Apr- Jun results. Earnings at many companies were trending ahead of FY3/26 guidance announced with FY3/25 results, reflecting 1) conservative company demand assumptions, 2) a limited tariff impact, including on demand, and 3) a weaker- than- expected yen. We forecast investor sentiment will continue to improve in Jul- Sep on expectations of upward revisions to guidance. As before, our top sector picks are Ibiden, which should benefit from strong Al server- related demand; TDK, for which we see strong profit growth expectations driven by an increase in smartphone battery value- added; and Rohm and Kyocera, which we expect to benefit from restructuring.

Tariff impact - Electronic component inventory buildup before the introduction of tariffs was limited, and we believe the risk of a demand pullback in Jul- Sep is low. However, demand could be affected by indirect factors (a spike in demand for high- end smartphones, etc.). We note that Kyocera factored printer exports to the US into guidance as a direct impact. Niterra performs front- end processing of spark plugs in Japan and exports them to the US. GS Yuasa assumed sales of industrial batteries and power sources in North America would be affected by tariffs in its initial guidance. Broad cuts to initially slated tariff rates are an upside factor to guidance.

Demand recovery - We have confirmed Apr- Jun sales trends at 17 sector firms. Aggregate sales declined \(1.8\%\) YoY/4.2% QoQ. Growth by application was as follows: automotive \(- 5.7\% / - 6.2\%\) industrial equipment \(+6.0\% / + 0.7\%\) , smartphones \(+2.3\% / + 0.3\%\) . A recovery trend for industrial equipment applications has become apparent, and if it continues, we believe expectations of sales recovering at Rohm, Hirose, and other firms will rise. We also forecast advances in vehicle electrification and growth in server- related demand will support a gradual recovery in demand for electronic components.

Our thinking in the run- up to July- September results - Upcoming events include the submission of Nidec's Yuho securities report for FY3/25, which is due on September 26. We hope this exhausts bad news. Looking ahead to Jul- Sep results announcements, we expect progress on restructuring to be a share price catalyst for Kyocera and Rohm. We also expect Ibiden, TDK, Hirose, Rohm, Kyocera, and Murata to revise up full- guidance when they announce results.

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

We expect Ibiden to disclose its FY3/27 outlook with HI results; we expect it to be positive.25334Niterra33.835.053%130.0132.9130.4145.4Apr-Jun earnings beat guidance; however the share price range had risen on expectations of progress on the transfer of Denso's spark plug business and we think it will struggle to rise further36592Mabuchi6.45.7-22.221.221.222.0Shareholder returns announced with Apr-Jun results were positive, but this has in our view been priced in. We see few catalysts in the short term but we highlight M&amp;A trends as a point to watch.46594Nidec61.564.348%260.0261.1271.0310.0HDD demand was stronger than expected and the improvement in automotive business profitability was positive. If the investigation into accounting issues is completed without any problem, all the bad news should be out.56674GS Yuasa8.310.437%51.052.453.054.6Subsidies are a tailwind for regular industrial business demand, and we expect strong progress toward guidance to continue in Jul-Sep and beyond.66762TDK56.480.568%202.5235.8259.0293.0We forecast profit will increase YoY in Jul-Sep, centering on batteries. We believe the recovery in demand for passive components will become a share price driver.76770Alps Alpine3.76.963%17.020.828.536.9Alps has already revised up guidance. The next focal point is the extent to which the MTP update slated for announcement with HI results boosts expectations of profit growth from FY3/27.86806Hirose Elec9.811.856%38.542.742.046.0While the improvement in industrial equipment-related demand left a positive impression, profitability deterioration caused by an increase in personnel expenses and other fixed costs was somewhat negative.96963Rohm0.22.362%4.05.646.046.0We believe there are expectations of upward revisions to full-year guidance with HI results. Rohm is also scheduled to announce production structure reorganization details, a new MTP, and progress on talks with Toshiba. We expect the share price environment to remain favorable in the short term.106966Mitsui HT3.52.647%13.013.713.317.1We see potential for May-July profit to beat our estimate, depending on upfront investment in the motor core business, and we forecast profit will bottom in May-July.116971Kyocera18.621.372%55.079.383.1104.0Business portfolio restructuring advanced in Apr-Jun, and we believe expectations of profitability improvement are rising. We see potential for many catalysts in the HI announcement, including further progress on portfolio reforms.126976Taiyo Yuden3.1--16.016.316.025.0MLCC demand is solid. While this has been factored into the share price to some extent, we expect the underlying profit recovery trend to continue.136981Murata61.676.563%220.0252.7266.0307.0While valuations are not particularly compelling, we think the share price could increase in the short term if Murata forecasts a recovery in RF module market share in FY3/27.146996Nichicon0.71.232%6.06.56.89.7The recovery in demand for aluminum electrolytic capacitors has been subdued, but we highlight growth in energy storage demand from Jul-Sep on seasonal factors as a point to watch.157240NOK7.012.652%37.737.938.542.8We think results from Jul-Sep will be largely in line with trends for FY3/25. While valuations are not particularly appealing, we expect a high dividend yield to provide share price support.
Source: Citi Research.

Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

Regulations in various jurisdictions require that where a recommendation differs from any of the author's previous recommendations concerning the same financial instrument or issuer that has been published during the preceding 12- month period that the change(s) and the date of that previous recommendation are indicated. For fundamental coverage please refer to the price chart or rating change history within this disclosure appendix or the issuer disclosure summary at https://www.citvileocity.com/cvr/eppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

A description of these policies can be found at https://www.citvileocity.com/cvr/eppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy", "Hold", "Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the % of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV \(0.4\%\) (86%); Q1 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV \(0.5\%\) (87%); Q4 2024 Buy \(32\%\) (64%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (44%), RV \(0.4\%\) (92%); Q3 2024 Buy \(33\%\) (61%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV \(0.4\%\) (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

European regulations require a 5 year price history when past performance of a security is referenced. CitiVelocity's Charting Tool (https://www.citivelocity.com/cv2/#go/CHARTING_3_Equities) provides the facility to create customisable price charts including a five year option. This tool can be found in the Data & Analytics section under any of the asset class menus in CitiVelocity (https://www.citivelocity.com/). For further information contact CitiVelocity support (https://www.citivelocity.com/cv2/go/CLIENT_SUPPORT). The source for all referenced prices, unless otherwise stated, is DataCentral, which sources price information from Thomson Reuters. Past performance is not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future results. Forecasts are not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future performance.

Citi Research broadly and simultaneously disseminates its research content to the Firm's institutional and retail clients via the Firm's proprietary electronic distribution platforms (e.g., Citi Velocity and various Global Wealth platforms). As a convenience, certain, but not all, research content may be distributed through third party aggregators. Clients may receive published research reports by email, on a discretionary basis, and only after such research content has been broadly disseminated. Certain research is made available only to institutional investors to satisfy regulatory requirements. The level and types of services provided by Citi Research analysts to clients may vary depending on various factors such as the client's individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communications from analysts, the client's risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g. market- wide, sector specific, long term, short- term etc.), the size and scope of the overall client relationship with the Firm and legal and regulatory constraints.

Pursuant to Comissão de Valores Mobiliários Resolução 20 and ASIC Regulatory Guide 264, Citi is required to disclose whether a Citi related company or business has a commercial relationship with the subject company. Considering that Citi operates multiple businesses in more than 100 countries around the world, it is likely that Citi has a commercial relationship with the subject company.

Although Citi Research does not set a predetermined frequency for publication, if the Product is a fundamental equity or credit research report, it is the intention of Citi Research to provide research coverage of the covered issuers, including in response to news affecting the issuer. For non- fundamental research reports, Citi Research may not provide regular updates to the views, recommendations and facts included in the reports. Citi Research may provide different research products and services to different classes of customers (for example, based upon long- term or short- term investment horizons) that may lead to differing conclusions or recommendations that could impact the price of a security contrary to the recommendations in the alternative research product, provided that each is consistent with the rating system for each respective product.
